rows.text: The crusader Livonian Brothers of the Sword are founded.
Saaremaa islanders ravage areas of Southern Sweden, then belonging to Denmark. The returning pirates skirmish with the German settlers of Riga near the town of Visby in Gotland.
Valdemar II of Denmark builds a fortress in Saaremaa, but burns it down after finding no volunteers to man it.
The Terra Mariana ("Land of St Mary) is established as the political unit of crusaders in Livonia.
Sword Brothers, Letts and Livs invade Sakala and Ugandi in Southern Estonia, starting the Estonian Ancient Fight for Freedom (1208-1227).
Estonians besiege the Cēsis stronghold in Latvia.
Estonians defeat the Sword Brothers and Livs in the Battle of Ümera in Latvia.
Pskov and Novgorod troops besiege the Otepää stronghold.
Pskov troops raid Western Estonia.
Summer
Estonians are defeated by Sword Brothers in the Battle of Turaida in Latvia.
Sword Brothers are defeated by Estonians in the Battle of Viljandi.
Estonians raid crusader areas in Latvia.
Russian troops besiege the Varbola Stronghold.
Troops from Sakala, led by Lembitu of Lehola, burn Pskov.
Lithuanians raid the Sakala area.
Sword Brothers defeat Estonians in the Battle of Lehola.
Troops from Saaremaa besiege Riga.
Troops from Sakala raid crusader areas in Latvia.
Pskov troops capture the Otepää stronghold.
February
Sword Brothers are defeated by Estonians and Russians in the Battle of Otepää.
21 September
Sword Brothers, Latgalians and Livs defeat Estonians in the Battle of St. Matthew's Day, where the Estonian leader Lembitu of Lehola is killed.
15 June
Valdemar II of Denmark conquers Tallinn in the Battle of Lindanise and builds the Toompea Castle.
8 August
John I of Sweden invades Läänemaa, but is defeated by troops from Saaremaa in the Battle of Lihula.
Estonians besiege Tallinn.
The invading Danish troops are defeated by Estonians in Saaremaa.
29 January
Estonians defeat the Sword Brothers in the Battle of Viljandi and the entire Southern Estonia is liberated.
Estonians are defeated by Sword Brothers in Ümera, Latvia.
Pskov and Novgorod troops raid most of mainland Estonia.
15 August
Sword Brothers capture the Tartu stronghold from joint Estonian and Russian troops - mainland Estonia falls to the crusaders.
The Bishopric of Dorpat is established in Southeastern Estonia.
January
Sword Brothers conquer stronghold of Muhu, and last pagan stronghold of Valjala surrenders.
Sword Brothers conquer Northern Estonia from Denmark.
1 October
The Bishopric of Ösel–Wiek is established in Western Estonia.
Pskov and Novgorod troops invade the Bishopric of Dorpat, that is forced to pay tribute for four years.
De Lode brothers in Kullamaa Parish refuse to recognize the new Bishop of Ösel-Wiek.
22 September
Sword Brothers are defeated by Samogitians in the Battle of Saule. Saaremaa islanders rebel against German rule.
Livonian Brothers of the Sword merge into the Teutonic Order and become known as the Livonian Order, autonomous of the Teutonic Order State.
The Livonian Order helps restore the power of the Bishop of Ösel Wiek in Kullamaa Parish.
5 April
The Livonian Order and Estonians are defeated by Novgorod in the Battle of the Ice.
18 February
Pskov and Novgorod defeat the Livonian Order in the Battle of Rakvere, ending the Order's attempts to invade Russia.
16 February
Lithuanians defeat the Livonian Order in the Battle of Karuse.
Tallinn becomes a member of the Hanseatic League.
A border war between the Livonian Order and the Bishopric of Ösel-Wiek.
